fs.f: q --˃ /g/ + affrication (in the environment of anterior vowel) ǵ
q --˃ /g/ + affrication (in the environment of anterior vowel) ǧ

revisionDesc.change: reworked example: * proposed renaming of "occurence" to "featureRealisation" * made
reworked examples based on last meeting: * tentatively added f[@name="explanation"] to featureValues

div.p: Uvular realisation is preserved in MSA loanwords, ex. taqrīban «approximately», qarīban «soon» and in some Turkish loanwords, ex. qawūn «melon» and by young speakers often in words realized with /g/ or /ǧ/ by older speakers, ex. gidīm or ǧidim - qadīm «old», gilīl or ǧilīl - qalīl «few, little» ; Devoicing of /g/ to /k/ in contact with /t/, ex. k-t-l (which sometimes becomes affricated in the environment of an anterior vowel c-t-l)

f.name: note
f.string: Devoicing of /g/ when before /t/- ex. ktirab «he approached»

f.name: note
f.string: Uvular realisation is preserved in MSA loanwords

f.name: note
f.string: Uvular realisation is preserved in MSA loanwords, ex. taqrīban «approximately» and in some Turkish loanwords, ex. qawūn «melon» and by young speakers often in words realized with /g/ or /ǧ/ by older speakers, ex. gidīm or ǧidim - qadīm «old»; Devoicing of /g/ to /k/ in contact with /t/, ex. k-t-l (which sometimes becomes affricated in the environment of an anterior vowel c-t-l)

f.name: note
f.string: Women seem to use more hamza, which is characteristically perceived as urban. Christian women are the ones that use hamza more distinctively

f.name: note
f.string: Women seem to use more hamza, which is characteristically perceived as urban. Christian women are the ones that use hamza more distinctively

f.name: note
f.string: De-voicing occurs word-finally in pausal forms; e.g. in šigg>šikk, sūg>sūk; this is not limited to reflexes of /q/, but occurs for other consonants as well. Katz notes that /q/ is very rare and only occurs in a few loanwords from MSA such as qurʔān.

f.name: note
f.string: Velarisation of g occurrs in emphatic environment: gamar "moon"; /k/ in vicinity of voiceless consonants + root *qtl and *qtr

f.name: note
f.string: in the contiguity of front vowels g can but need not to be realized as affricates [dz]

f.name: note
f.string: vestigial variants of q>ǧ: ʕeǧib "young children", ǧiddāmi "in front of me", ǧider "cauldron"

f.name: note
f.string: /q/ in vicinity of voiceless consonants with root *w - q- t /k/ in vicinity of voiceless consonants with root *q-t-l
